metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23601 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Navigations were being allowed when dragging a URL from a cross-originiframe into the same tab which could lead to website spoofing attacks. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 109, Thunderbird < 102.7, and Firefox ESR <102.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23601` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
